types.name: CreateCalculationParams

types.description:
Create a Constraint

  Example:
  ```
  mutation {
  createConstraint (
    input: {
      decisionId: null
      input: {
        calculationId: 0
        decisionId: 1
        enabled: true
        lhs: null
        operator: EQUAL_TO
        optionFilterId: 1
        relaxable: true
        rhs: 6
        slug: "options-6"
        title: "Option Count equal to 6"
        variableId: 1
      }
    }
  ) {
    successful
    messages {
      field
      message
      code
    }
    result {
      calculationId
      decisionId
      enabled
      id
      insertedAt
      lhs
      operator
      optionFilterId
      relaxable
      rhs
      slug
      title
      updatedAt
      variableId
    }
  }
}
  ```
  returns

  ```
  {
  "data": {
    "createConstraint": {
      "calculationId": 0,
      "decisionId": 1,
      "enabled": true,
      "id": 1,
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "lhs": null,
      "operator": EQUAL_TO,
      "optionFilterId": 1,
      "relaxable": true,
      "rhs": 6,
      "slug": "options-6",
      "title": "Option Count equal to 6",
      "updatedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "variableId": 1
    }
  }
}
  ```

types.name: CreateConstraintParams

types.description:
Add a Criteria

  Example:
  ```
  mutation {
  createCriteria (
    input: {
      decisionId: null
      input: {
        applyParticipantWeights: true
        bins: 5
        decisionId: 1
        info: "Is this a good value?"
        slug: "value"
        sort: 1
        supportOnly: false
        title: "Value"
        weighting: 10
      }
    }
  ) {
    successful
    messages {
      field
      message
      code
    }
    result {
      applyParticipantWeights
      bins
      decisionId
      deleted
      id
      info
      insertedAt
      slug
      sort
      supportOnly
      title
      updatedAt
      weighting
    }
  }
}
  ```
  returns

  ```
  {
  "data": {
    "createCriteria": {
      "applyParticipantWeights": true,
      "bins": 5,
      "decisionId": 1,
      "deleted": false,
      "id": 1,
      "info": "Is this a good value?",
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "slug": "value",
      "sort": 1,
      "supportOnly": false,
      "title": "Value",
      "updatedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "weighting": 10
    }
  }
}
  ```

inputFields.description: A boolean indicating if Participant weighting should be applied to this OptionCategory
inputFields.name: applyParticipantWeights

inputFields.description:
The number of vote increments to allow, between one and nine.

These will correspond to the number of buttons or inputs on the presentation layer. While the actual interface is up to the presentation layer, we recommend using a Likert Scale.

For example, if a Criteria has 5 bins, then presentation layer could show 5 buttons:
[Strongly Disapprove] [Disapprove] [Neutral] [Approve] [Strongly Approve]
inputFields.name: bins

inputFields.description: The Decision the Criteria belongs to.
inputFields.name: decisionId

inputFields.description: Object is flagged to delete on publish (soft delete)
inputFields.name: deleted

inputFields.description: Informative text describing the Criteria.
inputFields.name: info

inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.
inputFields.name: slug

inputFields.description: The sort order for display
inputFields.name: sort

inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the Criteria should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo algorythm takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many Participants are "for" or "against" an Option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - Participants who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".
inputFields.name: supportOnly

inputFields.description: Name of Criteria. Used to generate slug if none supplied
inputFields.name: title

inputFields.description: Multiplier for a Decision-wide weighting to all votes to this Criteria. Participant specific weightings can also be entered.
inputFields.name: weighting

  createDecision (
    input: {
      copyable: false
      info: "There can be only one true pizza. Choose wisely."
      internal: false
      keywords: [
        a,b,12
      ]
      language: "en"
      maxUsers: 10
      slug: "pizza-chooser"
      title: "Pizza Chooser Extraordinaire"
    }
  ) {
    copyable
    id
    info
    insertedAt
    internal
    keywords
    language
    maxUsers
    slug
    title
    updatedAt
  }
}
  ```
  returns

  ```
  {
  "data": {
    "createDecision": {
      "copyable": false,
      "id": 1,
      "info": "There can be only one true pizza. Choose wisely.",
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "internal": false,
      "keywords": [
        a,b,12
      ]
      ,
      "language": "en",
      "maxUsers": 10,
      "slug": "pizza-chooser",
      "title": "Pizza Chooser Extraordinaire",
      "updatedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00"
    }
  }
}

inputFields.name: keywords

inputFields.description: The OptionDetail to use to order the Options when converting OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes to BinVotes. Option Details allow arbitrary data added to an Option.
inputFields.name: primaryDetailId

inputFields.description: If Quadradtic Voting should be used
inputFields.name: quadratic

inputFields.description: Optional alternate title to use in charts
inputFields.name: resultsTitle

inputFields.description:
When OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes exist, the scoring mode is used to convert them into BinVotes.

To convert to BinVotes, the Options in the OptionCategory are sorted by their OptionDetailValues connected with the PrimaryDetail to put them in an ordered list. This list is then used to determine if an Option is selected or not.


- none
  Default Value. Option Category Voting will not be applied.
- rectangle
  Selected items are assigned BinVotes at Bin 9 (highest possible), remaining Options have BinVotes at the bin 1
- triangle
  Highest BinVote is at selected item, and reduces for items farther away. The farthest ends have BinVotes in bin 1
inputFields.name: scoringMode

inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.
inputFields.name: slug

inputFields.description: The sort order for display
inputFields.name: sort

inputFields.name: title

inputFields.description: The width of the triangle (number of Options included) to use in triangle scoring
inputFields.name: triangleBase

inputFields.description: Toggle if votes are on the percentage value or the flat fee value
inputFields.name: voteOnPercent

inputFields.description:
This value is used to indicate which voting widget to use for this OptionCategory on the frontend. This is only applied when using triangle or rectangle voting modes. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating Scenarios.


- range
  Display a voting widget that allows input of both a 'high' and a 'low' Option. Votes will be applied to all items in the range. 
- one
  Display a voting widget that allows input of a single Option.
inputFields.name: votingStyle

inputFields.description: Multiplier for a Decision-wide weighting to all votes to Options in the OptionCategory. Participant specific weightings can also be entered through OptionCategoryWeights.
inputFields.name: weighting

inputFields.description: A boolean indicating if this OptionCategory should have an XOR Constraint applied (only one Option in the OptionCategory can be chosen in the solution. This Constraint will not show when querying other Constraints. )
inputFields.name: xor

types.name: CreateOptionDetailFilterParams

inputFields.description: The Decision the OptionDetail belongs to.
inputFields.name: decisionId

inputFields.description:
An optional string that can be used to trigger display code on the presentation layer.

For example, a hint of "Dollars" or "Money" could be added to an OptionDetail to let the presentation layer know to format it as $x.xx
It is up to the presentation layer to render or parse this field. The Ethelo engine does not use this value.
inputFields.name: displayHint

inputFields.description:
Each detail must have a format.

Choosing a format DOES NOT add validation to the user's input. Format settings are used to identify what
valid Variables and OptionFilters can be configured.
Invalid values WILL NOT be included when Calculations are run.


- string
  Default Value. Data should be interpreted as text. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.
- integer
  Data should be interpreted as an integer (no decimals). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- float
  Data should be interpreted as a float/decimal. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- boolean
  Data should be interpreted as a boolean (true/false). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for "true" and "false" matches
- datetime
  Data should be interpreted a date with time. OptionFilter and Filter Variables can be configured for various time parts (Year, Month, ...)
inputFields.name: format

inputFields.description:
An optional string that can be used to provide guidance on how to fill out an OptionDetail on the presentation layer.

For example, a hint of "YYYY-MM-DD" could be added to an OptionDetail to let the admin user setting up Options know the preferred format for dates.

inputFields.description:
The number of vote increments to allow, between one and nine.

These will correspond to the number of buttons or inputs on the presentation layer. While the actual interface is up to the presentation layer, we recommend using a Likert Scale.

For example, if a ScenarioConfig has 5 bins, then presentation layer could show 5 buttons:
[Strongly Disapprove] [Disapprove] [Neutral] [Approve] [Strongly Approve]
inputFields.name: bins

inputFields.description:
= Collective Identity
Unity has a different relevance in different Decision contexts because the phenomenon in which a Decision becomes more powerful through unity is a social phenomenon; it doesnt appear if there is only one Participant.

For example, in a process where Participants do not have relationships or the sense of reciprocity that arises in community, it may not be important that Participants experience similar levels of support for solutions, or feel that influence in shaping the solutions was distributed fairly. However, in a stakeholder process where there are entitlements resting on a collective identity, then fairness in support distribution can be quite important.  represents the importance of unity in a specific Decision context.

Collective Identity () determines the impact of Unity on a Decision. The higher the Collective Identity value, the more important it is that the selected solutions have similar levels of support across Participants.
inputFields.name: collectiveIdentity

inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the ScenarioConfig should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo algorithm takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many people are "for" or "against" an option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - people who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".
inputFields.name: supportOnly

inputFields.description: As consensus for a Scenarios decreases, there will be a tipping point when people will cease to resist the solutions because of inequality aversion, and begin to support it due to fairness and the unity it creates. Where this neutral tipping point is found will depend on the type of Decision process and group dynamics.  By default, we set the tipping point at about 1/3rds consensus.
inputFields.name: tippingPoint

        lhs: null
        operator: EQUAL_TO

        variableId: 1

fields.description:
Add a Decosopm

  Example:
  ```
  mutation {
  createDecision (
    input: {
      copyable: false
      info: "There can be only one true pizza. Choose wisely."
      internal: false
      keywords: [
        a,b,12

types.description: Options are the choices that a make up a Decision solution. Your solution may include multiple Options.

fields.description: Boolean to indicate if the inclusion of the Option should be based on if it has positive votes

fields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the Option should be included in the Ethelo algorythm. Defaults to "true".

This is a convenience setting to allow you to quickly iterate on a Decision setup without having to recreate Options.
fields.name: enabled

fields.description: Unique identifier.
fields.name: id

fields.description: Informative text describing the Option.
fields.name: info

fields.description: Date/time item was created.
fields.name: insertedAt

fields.description: The OptionCategory to source the value from. Options must define an OptionCategory. OptionCategories are used to specify the importance of Options. Each group has a specific "weight" applied, making the Options more or less important when calculating the best result.
fields.name: optionCategoryId

fields.description: Name of Option to display in results. Reverts to title if not entered

types.name: Option

fields.description: A boolean indicating if Participants weighting should be applied to this OptionCategory
fields.name: applyParticipantWeights

fields.description: The % amount of the total budget this OptionCategory represents. Used to calculate tax assessment values.
fields.name: budgetPercent

fields.description: The default 'high' Option to use when range votes are applied. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating Scenarios. Options are the choices that a make up a Decision solution.
fields.name: defaultHighOption

fields.description: The default 'high' Option to use when range votes are applied. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating Scenarios. Options are the choices that a make up a Decision solution.
fields.name: defaultHighOptionId

fields.description: The default Option to use when 'pick one' votes are applied, or the 'low' Option to use when range votes are applied. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating scenarios. Options are the choices that a make up a Decision solution.
fields.name: defaultLowOption

fields.description: The default Option to use when 'pick one' votes are applied, or the 'low' Option to use when range votes are applied. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating scenarios. Options are the choices that a make up a Decision solution.
fields.name: defaultLowOptionId

fields.description: Object is flagged to delete on publish (soft delete)
fields.name: deleted

fields.description: The $ amount this category adds to every tax assessment. Used to calculate tax assessment values.
fields.name: flatFee

fields.description: Unique identifier.
fields.name: id

fields.description: Informative text describing the OptionCategory.
fields.name: info

fields.description: Date/time item was created.
fields.name: insertedAt

fields.description: Text used by frontend search feature
fields.name: keywords

fields.description: A list of Options in the OptionCategory. Options are the choices that a make up a Decision solution.
fields.name: options

fields.description: The OptionDetail to use to order the Options when converting OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes to BinVotes. Option Details allow arbitrary data added to an Option.
fields.name: primaryDetail

fields.description: The OptionDetail to use to order the Options when converting OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes to BinVotes. Option Details allow arbitrary data added to an Option.
fields.name: primaryDetailId

fields.description: If Quadradtic Voting should be used
fields.name: quadratic

fields.description: Optional alternate title to use in charts
fields.name: resultsTitle

fields.description:
When OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes exist, the scoring mode is used to convert them into BinVotes.

To convert to BinVotes, the Options in the OptionCategory are sorted by their OptionDetailValues connected with the PrimaryDetail to put them in an ordered list. This list is then used to determine if an Option is selected or not.


- none
  Default Value. Option Category Voting will not be applied.
- rectangle
  Selected items are assigned BinVotes at Bin 9 (highest possible), remaining Options have BinVotes at the bin 1
- triangle
  Highest BinVote is at selected item, and reduces for items farther away. The farthest ends have BinVotes in bin 1
fields.name: scoringMode

fields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.
fields.name: slug

fields.description: The sort order for display
fields.name: sort

fields.description: Name of OptionCategory. Used to generate slug if none supplied
fields.name: title

fields.description: The width of the triangle (number of Options included) to use in triangle scoring
fields.name: triangleBase

fields.description: Date/time item was last updated.
fields.name: updatedAt

fields.description: Toggle if votes are on the percentage value or the flat fee value
fields.name: voteOnPercent

fields.description:
This value is used to indicate which voting widget to use for this OptionCategory on the frontend. This is only applied when using triangle or rectangle voting modes. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating Scenarios.


- range
  Display a voting widget that allows input of both a 'high' and a 'low' Option. Votes will be applied to all items in the range. 
- one
  Display a voting widget that allows input of a single Option.
fields.name: votingStyle

fields.description: Multiplier for a Decision-wide weighting to all votes to Options in the OptionCategory. Participant specific weightings can also be entered through OptionCategoryWeights.
fields.name: weighting

fields.name: displayHint

fields.description:
Each detail must have a format.

Choosing a format DOES NOT add validation to the user's input. Format settings are used to identify what
valid Variables and OptionFilters can be configured.
Invalid values WILL NOT be included when Calculations are run.


- string
  Default Value. Data should be interpreted as text. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.
- integer
  Data should be interpreted as an integer (no decimals). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- float
  Data should be interpreted as a float/decimal. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- boolean
  Data should be interpreted as a boolean (true/false). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for "true" and "false" matches
- datetime
  Data should be interpreted a date with time. OptionFilter and Filter Variables can be configured for various time parts (Year, Month, ...)

fields.description:
The number of vote increments to allow, between one and nine.

These will correspond to the number of buttons or inputs on the presentation layer. While the actual interface is up to the presentation layer, we recommend using a Likert Scale.

For example, if a ScenarioConfig has 5 bins, then presentation layer could show 5 buttons:
[Strongly Disapprove] [Disapprove] [Neutral] [Approve] [Strongly Approve]
fields.name: bins

fields.description:
= Collective Identity
Unity has a different relevance in different Decision contexts because the phenomenon in which a Decision becomes more powerful through unity is a social phenomenon; it doesnt appear if there is only one Participant.

For example, in a process where Participants do not have relationships or the sense of reciprocity that arises in community, it may not be important that Participants experience similar levels of support for solutions, or feel that influence in shaping the solutions was distributed fairly. However, in a stakeholder process where there are entitlements resting on a collective identity, then fairness in support distribution can be quite important.  represents the importance of unity in a specific Decision context.

Collective Identity () determines the impact of Unity on a Decision. The higher the Collective Identity value, the more important it is that the selected solutions have similar levels of support across Participants.
fields.name: collectiveIdentity

fields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the ScenarioConfig should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo algorithm takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many people are "for" or "against" an option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - people who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".
fields.name: supportOnly

fields.description: As consensus for a Scenarios decreases, there will be a tipping point when people will cease to resist the solutions because of inequality aversion, and begin to support it due to fairness and the unity it creates. Where this neutral tipping point is found will depend on the type of Decision process and group dynamics.  By default, we set the tipping point at about 1/3rds consensus.

types.description:
When OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes exist, the scoring mode is used to convert them into BinVotes.

To convert to BinVotes, the Options in the OptionCategory are sorted by their OptionDetailValues connected with the PrimaryDetail to put them in an ordered list. This list is then used to determine if an Option is selected or not.

enumValues.description: Default Value. Option Category Voting will not be applied.
enumValues.name: NONE

enumValues.description: Selected items are assigned BinVotes at Bin 9 (highest possible), remaining Options have BinVotes at the bin 1
enumValues.name: RECTANGLE

enumValues.description: Highest BinVote is at selected item, and reduces for items farther away. The farthest ends have BinVotes in bin 1
enumValues.name: TRIANGLE

types.name: UpdateCalculationParams

types.description:
Update a Constraint

  Example:
  ```
  mutation {
  updateConstraint (
    input: {
      decisionId: null
      input: {
        calculationId: 4
        decisionId: 1
        enabled: true
        lhs: null
        operator: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
        optionFilterId: 1
        relaxable: true
        rhs: 20
        slug: "profit-at-least-20"
        title: "Profit Margin >= 20"
        variableId: null
      }
    }
  ) {
    successful
    messages {
      field
      message
      code
    }
    result {
      calculationId
      decisionId
      enabled
      id
      insertedAt
      lhs
      operator
      optionFilterId
      relaxable
      rhs
      slug
      title
      updatedAt
      variableId
    }
  }
}
  ```
  returns

  ```
  {
  "data": {
    "updateConstraint": {
      "calculationId": 4,
      "decisionId": 1,
      "enabled": true,
      "id": 1,
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "lhs": null,
      "operator": GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO,
      "optionFilterId": 1,
      "relaxable": true,
      "rhs": 20,
      "slug": "profit-at-least-20",
      "title": "Profit Margin >= 20",
      "updatedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "variableId": null
    }
  }
}
  ```

types.description:
Update a Criteria

  Example:
  ```
  mutation {
  updateCriteria (
    input: {
      decisionId: null
      input: {
        applyParticipantWeights: false
        bins: 7
        decisionId: 1
        info: "Is the price a good value?"
        slug: "price"
        sort: 4
        supportOnly: false
        title: "Price"
      }
    }
  ) {
    successful
    messages {
      field
      message
      code
    }
    result {
      applyParticipantWeights
      bins
      decisionId
      deleted
      id
      info
      insertedAt
      slug
      sort
      supportOnly
      title
      updatedAt
      weighting
    }
  }
}
  ```
  returns

  ```
  {
  "data": {
    "updateCriteria": {
      "applyParticipantWeights": false,
      "bins": 7,
      "decisionId": 1,

A boolean that indicates if the Criteria should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo algorythm takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many Participants are "for" or "against" an Option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - Participants who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

inputFields.description:
When OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes exist, the scoring mode is used to convert them into BinVotes.

To convert to BinVotes, the Options in the OptionCategory are sorted by their OptionDetailValues connected with the PrimaryDetail to put them in an ordered list. This list is then used to determine if an Option is selected or not.


- none
  Default Value. Option Category Voting will not be applied.
- rectangle
  Selected items are assigned BinVotes at Bin 9 (highest possible), remaining Options have BinVotes at the bin 1
- triangle
  Highest BinVote is at selected item, and reduces for items farther away. The farthest ends have BinVotes in bin 1

It is up to the presentation layer to render or parse this field. The Ethelo engine does not use this value.

inputFields.description:
Each detail must have a format.

Choosing a format DOES NOT add validation to the user's input. Format settings are used to identify what
valid Variables and OptionFilters can be configured.
Invalid values WILL NOT be included when Calculations are run.


- string
  Default Value. Data should be interpreted as text. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.
- integer
  Data should be interpreted as an integer (no decimals). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- float
  Data should be interpreted as a float/decimal. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- boolean
  Data should be interpreted as a boolean (true/false). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for "true" and "false" matches
- datetime
  Data should be interpreted a date with time. OptionFilter and Filter Variables can be configured for various time parts (Year, Month, ...)

inputFields.description:
The number of vote increments to allow, between one and nine.

These will correspond to the number of buttons or inputs on the presentation layer. While the actual interface is up to the presentation layer, we recommend using a Likert Scale.

For example, if a ScenarioConfig has 5 bins, then presentation layer could show 5 buttons:
[Strongly Disapprove] [Disapprove] [Neutral] [Approve] [Strongly Approve]
inputFields.name: bins

inputFields.description:
= Collective Identity
Unity has a different relevance in different Decision contexts because the phenomenon in which a Decision becomes more powerful through unity is a social phenomenon; it doesnt appear if there is only one Participant.

For example, in a process where Participants do not have relationships or the sense of reciprocity that arises in community, it may not be important that Participants experience similar levels of support for solutions, or feel that influence in shaping the solutions was distributed fairly. However, in a stakeholder process where there are entitlements resting on a collective identity, then fairness in support distribution can be quite important.  represents the importance of unity in a specific Decision context.

Collective Identity () determines the impact of Unity on a Decision. The higher the Collective Identity value, the more important it is that the selected solutions have similar levels of support across Participants.
inputFields.name: collectiveIdentity

If enabled only the global "all options" Scenario will be generated and added to the resulting ScenarioSet.

inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the ScenarioConfig should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo algorithm takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many people are "for" or "against" an option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - people who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".
inputFields.name: supportOnly

inputFields.description: As consensus for a Scenarios decreases, there will be a tipping point when people will cease to resist the solutions because of inequality aversion, and begin to support it due to fairness and the unity it creates. Where this neutral tipping point is found will depend on the type of Decision process and group dynamics.  By default, we set the tipping point at about 1/3rds consensus.

types.description:
Validation messages are returned when mutation input does not meet the requirements.
  While client-side validation is highly recommended to provide the best User Experience,
  All inputs will always be validated server-side.

  Some examples of validations are:

  * Username must be at least 10 characters
  * Email field does not contain an email address
  * Birth Date is required

  While GraphQL has support for required values, mutation data fields are always
  set to optional in our API. This allows 'required field' messages
  to be returned in the same manner as other validations. The only exceptions
  are id fields, which may be required to perform updates or deletes.

fields.description: A unique error code for the type of validation used.
fields.name: code

fields.description:
The input field that the error applies to. The field can be used to
identify which field the error message should be displayed next to in the
presentation layer.

If there are multiple errors to display for a field, multiple validation
messages will be in the result.

This field may be null in cases where an error cannot be applied to a specific field.
fields.name: field

fields.description:
A friendly error message, appropriate for display to the end user.

The message is interpolated to include the appropriate variables.

Example: `Username must be at least 10 characters`

This message may change without notice, so we do not recommend you match against the text.
Instead, use the *code* field for matching.
fields.name: message

fields.description: A list of substitutions to be applied to a validation message template
fields.name: options

fields.description:
A template used to generate the error message, with placeholders for option substiution.

Example: `Username must be at least {count} characters`

This message may change without notice, so we do not recommend you match against the text.
Instead, use the *code* field for matching.
fields.name: template

types.name: ValidationMessage
